page.title: 04SHERIFF HUTTON RURAL SCENE
page.content: A thousand years of occupation stamps the landscape,Rigg and Furrow are in evidence,also an old sunken road,now used as a modern way.On the grassy banks of this road and around the village daffodils have been planted.The two village greens remain unchanged except for the tree planting during the last ten years. Two places of worship remain,the 800 year od church at East End,a new chapel at West End replacing one biult in 1794.The village school,biult in 1961,replaced the old board school,now a private house,and the methodist school,now a Christian youth centre. Two public houses,now modernised,are well used;they also serve food.Streets are lit by eletric lights.A derelict wooden Memorial Hall,no longer in use, was replaced in 1984 by a new village hall.
